title: Serif Book Typeface, Published 1974
content:
I’m still not particularly good at identifying typography, and have been trying to identify the typeface used in a book of essays by Jung published in 1974. It seems like a relatively common serif, which is partly why I feel sort of silly not being able to identify it!

[Chapter Title Page](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172956/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/misterghostie/2844314240/sizes/l/)  
 [Recto + Verso](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172956/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/misterghostie/2844314246/sizes/l/)

EDIT: Some more Photos (though a Baskerville looks accurate).

[Book Text, Closeup](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172956/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/misterghostie/2844447958/sizes/m/)  
 [Section Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172956/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/misterghostie/2844447948/sizes/o/)

Thanks for the help!

 [‹ T-shirt font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172956/http:/typophile.com/node/49260 "Go to previous forum topic") [Eg Egiziano Bold ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081013172956/http:/typophile.com/node/49284 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jcockrell

comments.content: The type is too small to identify. Don’t you have it a bit bigger?
